meanings.definition: The belief or practice of being foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: Her constant dodoism made it hard for others to take her seriously.
meanings.sent2: His dodoism in class always resulted in him being the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: The dodoism of wearing shorts in the snow was both amusing and concerning.
meanings.sent4: His dodoism was like a bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The dodoism of jumping into a pool with clothes on was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A foolish or stupid action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The dodoism of forgetting his keys again was frustrating.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but laugh at his dodoism of trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent3: His dodoism of wearing mismatched socks to a job interview was both funny and ill-advised.
meanings.sent4: The dodoism of feeding spicy food to someone with a sensitive stomach was a recipe for disaster.
meanings.sent5: The dodoism of trying to start a campfire with wet wood was doomed from the start.
